tr: sexual activities (often including sexual intercourse) between two people
example: he hadn't had any love in months
he has a very complicated love life

tr: any object of warm affection or devotion
example: the theater was her first love
he has a passion for cock fighting

tr: a deep feeling of sexual desire and attraction
example: their love left them indifferent to their surroundings

tr: a strong positive emotion of regard and affection
example: children need a lot of love

tr: a score of zero in tennis or squash

example: This student sleeps with everyone in her dorm
Were you ever intimate with this man?

tr: have a great affection or liking for
example: She loves her boss and works hard for him

tr: be enamored or in love with

example.tran: 哦，埃米，我爱你。
example.ex: Oh, Amy, I love you...

example.tran: 我们彼此相爱。我们希望共度一生。
example.ex: We love each other. We want to spend our lives together.

value.def: If you love someone, you feel romantically or sexually attracted to them, and they are very important to you.

example.tran: 我们共同经历了这些风风雨雨后，彼此更加相爱了。
example.ex: Our love for each other has been increased by what we've been through together.

example.tran: 老式爱情故事
example.ex: ...a old fashioned love story.

example.tran: 情歌专辑
example.ex: ...an album of love songs.

value.def: Love is a very strong feeling of affection towards someone who you are romantically or sexually attracted to.

example.tran: 你决不会像疼爱自己的宝宝一样疼爱别人。
example.ex: You'll never love anyone the way you love your baby.

value.def: You say that you love someone when their happiness is very important to you, so that you behave in a kind and caring way towards them.

example.tran: 我对自己所有孩子的爱都是无条件的。
example.ex: My love for all my children is unconditional...

example.tran: 她很懂得如何去爱。
example.ex: She's  got a great capacity for love.

value.def: Love is the feeling that a person's happiness is very important to you, and the way you show this feeling in your behaviour towards them.

example.tran: 我们很喜欢这些食物，尤其是鱼。
example.ex: We loved the food so much, especially the fish dishes...

example.tran: 我很爱读书。
example.ex: I loved reading.

example.tran: 喜欢户外活动的这样一个人
example.ex: ...one of these people that loves to be in the outdoors...

example.tran: 我喜欢听你笑。
example.ex: I love it when I hear you laugh.

value.def: If you love something, you like it very much.

example.tran: 我热爱我的祖国，就像你热爱你的祖国一样。
example.ex: I love my country as you love yours.

value.def: You can say that you love something when you consider that it is important and want to protect or support it.

example.tran: 靠这种办法想激起对文学的热爱是行不通的。
example.ex: This is no way to encourage a love of literature...

example.tran: 法国人热爱自己的语言是出了名的。
example.ex: The French are known for their love of their language.

value.def: Love is a strong liking for something, or a belief that it is important.

example.tran: “她是我一生所爱，”他说道。
example.ex: 'She is the love of my life,' he said...

example.tran: 音乐是我的至爱之一。
example.ex: Music's one of my great loves.

value.def: Your love is someone or something that you love.

example.tran: 我很乐意再次为英格兰队效力。
example.ex: I would love to play for England again...

example.tran: 要是能洗个热水澡、换身干净的衣服就太好了。
example.ex: I would love a hot bath and clean clothes...

example.tran: 他妻子很乐意他辞去工作。
example.ex: His wife would love him to give up his job.

value.def: If you would love to have or do something, you very much want to have it or do it.

example.tran: 唔，那我就信你吧，亲爱的。
example.ex: Well, I'll take your word for it then, love...

example.tran: 别哭，亲爱的。
example.ex: Don't  cry, my love.

value.def: Some people use love as an affectionate way of addressing someone.

example.tran: 他3比0直取奥地利的托马斯·蒙斯特。
example.ex: He beat Thomas Muster of Austria three sets to love.

value.def: In tennis, love is a score of zero.

example.tran: 爱你的爷爷、奶奶
example.ex: ...with love from Grandma and Grandpa.

value.tran: （给朋友或亲人写信时结尾具名前的非正式用语）爱你（们）的
value.def: You can use expressions such as 'love', 'love from', and 'all my love', followed by your name, as an informal way of ending a letter to a friend or relation.

example.tran: 请代我问候她。
example.ex: Please give her my love.

value.def: If you send someone your love, you ask another person, who will soon be speaking or writing to them, to tell them that you are thinking about them with affection.

example.tran: 我爱上他，是因为他秉性善良。
example.ex: I fell in love with him because of his kind nature...

example.tran: 我们疯狂地相爱了。
example.ex: We fell madly in love.

value.def: If you fall in love with someone, you start to be in love with them.

example.tran: 与福特的密切合作开始令我爱上了电影。
example.ex: Working with Ford closely, I fell in love with the cinema.

value.def: If you fall in love with something, you start to like it very much.

example.tran: 劳拉之前从来没有恋爱过。
example.ex: Laura had never before been in love...

example.tran: 我从来没有真正爱上过谁。
example.ex: I've  never really been in love with anyone...

example.tran: 我们疯狂地热恋了大概两年。
example.ex: We were madly in love for about two years.

value.def: If you are in love with someone, you feel romantically or sexually attracted to them, and they are very important to you.

example.tran: 他一向热爱西部的迷人风光。
example.ex: He had always been in love with the enchanted landscape of the West.

value.def: If you are in love with something, you like it very much.

example.tran: 在一场日益严峻的危机面前，本应和睦共处、通力合作的这两个男人却势同水火。
example.ex: There was no love lost between the two men who were supposed to be working in harmony on a mounting crisis.

value.def: If you say that there is no love lost between two people or groups or there is little love lost between them, you mean that they do not like each other at all.

example.tran: 你和女孩有过云雨之欢吗？
example.ex: Have you ever made love to a girl before?...

example.tran: 一天晚上，做了18个月的朋友之后，他们第一次也是最后一次上了床。
example.ex: One night, after 18 months of friendship, they made love for the first and last time.

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, oft pl-n PHR, PHR <l>to/with</l> n

value.def: When two people make love, they have sex.

example.tran: 替换零件怎么都找不到。
example.ex: Replacement parts couldn't be found for love or money...

example.tran: 我不打算再回这里了，绝对不回了。
example.ex: I'm not coming back up here. Never, for love nor money.

value.def: If you cannot or will not do something for love or money, you are completely unable to do it or you do not intend to do it.

example.tran: 我们一见钟情，他6周后就向我求婚了。
example.ex: It was love at first sight, and he proposed to me six weeks later.

value.def: Love at first sight is the experience of starting to be in love with someone as soon as you see them for the first time.

data.enText: affection
a strong feeling of deep affection for sb/sth, especially a member of your family or a friend
a mother's love for her children
love of your country
He seems incapable of love.
romantic
a strong feeling of affection for sb that you are sexually attracted to
a love song/story
We're in love !
She was in love with him .
They fell in love with each other.
It was love at first sight (= they were attracted to each other the first time they met) .
They're madly in love .
Their love grew with the years.
enjoyment
the strong feeling of enjoyment that sth gives you
a love of learning
He's in love with his work.
I fell in love with the house.
sb/sth you like
a person, a thing or an activity that you like very much
data.chText: 心爱的人；钟爱之物；爱好

data.enText: Take care, my love.
He was the love of my life (= the person I loved most) .
data.chText: 他是我一生中最爱的人。

data.enText: I like most sports but tennis is my first love .
data.chText: 大多数运动我都喜欢，而网球是我的第一爱好。

data.enText: friendly name
a word used as a friendly way of addressing sb
Can I help you, love?
in tennis
a score of zero (points or games)
40–love!
She won the first set six–love/six games to love .
data.chText: 她以六比零赢了第一盘。

data.enText: (just) for love
(just) for the love of sth
without receiving payment or any other reward
data.chText: 出于爱好；不收报酬；无偿

data.enText: They're all volunteers, working for the love of it.
data.chText: 他们都是义务工作的志愿者。

data.enText: for the love of God
used when you are expressing anger and the fact that you are impatient
data.chText: （表示愤怒和不耐烦）看在上帝的分上，哎呀，求求你

data.enText: For the love of God, tell me what he said!
data.chText: 看在上帝的分上，告诉我他说了些什么！

data.enText: give/send my love to sb
used to send good wishes to sb
Give my love to Mary when you see her.
data.chText: 见到玛丽代我向她问好。

data.enText: Bob sends his love.
love from
lots of love (from)
used at the end of a letter to a friend or to sb you love, followed by your name
data.chText: （用于给朋友或所爱的人的信结尾具名前）爱你的

data.enText: Lots of love, Jenny
love is blind
when you love sb, you cannot see their faults
data.chText: 爱情是盲目的，爱让人蒙蔽双眼（指恋爱中的人看不到对方缺点）

data.enText: make love (to sb)
to have sex
It was the first time they had made love.
data.chText: 那是他们第一次发生性关系。

data.enText: not for love or/nor money
if you say you cannot do sth for love nor money , you mean it is completely impossible to do it
there's little/no love lost between A and B
they do not like each other
There's no love lost between her and her in-laws.
data.chText: 她和她的姻亲彼此嫌恶。

data.enText: cupboard love
affection that sb, especially a child, shows towards sb else in order to get sth
data.chText: （尤指小孩为获得某物的）有所企图的亲热

data.enText: all's fair in love and war
in some situations any type of behaviour is acceptable to get what you want
data.chText: 在情场和战场上可以不择手段

data.enText: head over heels in love
loving sb very much
He's fallen head over heels in love with his boss.
data.chText: 他深深迷恋上了他的上司。

data.enText: a labour of love
a hard task that you do because you want to, not because it is necessary
data.chText: 为爱好而做的困难工作

data.enText: feel affection

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to have very strong feelings of affection for sb
I love you.
If you love each other, why not get married?
data.chText: 要是你们彼此相爱，干吗不结婚呢？

data.enText: Her much-loved brother lay dying of AIDS.
data.chText: 她至爱的兄弟因艾滋病而濒临死亡。

data.enText: He had become a well-loved member of staff.
data.chText: 他已成为受人喜爱的职员。

data.enText: Relatives need time to grieve over loved ones they have lost.
data.chText: 亲属需要时间痛悼他们失去的至爱。

data.enText: to love your country
like/enjoy
to like or enjoy sth very much
I really love summer evenings.
data.chText: 我非常喜欢夏天的夜晚。

data.enText: I just love it when you bring me presents!
He loved the way she smiled.
I love it in Spain (= I like the life there) .
It was one of his best-loved songs.
data.chText: 这是他最受喜爱的歌曲之一。

data.enText: You're going to love this. They've changed their minds again.
data.chText: 你会喜欢的，他们又改变主意了。

data.enText: My dad loves going to football games.
I love to go out dancing.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He loved her to sing to him.
data.chText: 他喜欢让她唱歌给他听。

data.enText: used to say that you would very much like sth
Come on Rory, the kids would love to hear you sing.
data.chText: 来一首吧，罗里，孩子们都很喜欢听你唱歌。

data.enText: I haven't been to Brazil, but I'd love to go.
data.chText: 我没去过巴西，但很想去。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: I'd love her to come and live with us.
data.chText: 我很愿意让她来和我们住在一起。

data.enText: ‘Cigarette?’ ‘I'd love one, but I've just given up.’
data.chText: “抽支烟好吗？”“我倒很乐意抽一支，可我刚把烟戒了。”

data.enText: love you and leave you
used to say that you must go, although you would like to stay longer
data.chText: （表示想留而必须离开）不得不走

data.enText: Well, time to love you and leave you.
data.chText: 唉，我该走了，不想走也得走哇。

data.text: like ♦ love ♦ be fond of ♦ be keen on ♦ adore

data.enText: These words all mean to find sth pleasant, attractive or satisfactory, or to enjoy sth.
data.chText: 以上各词均含喜欢、喜爱某事物之义。

data.enText: like
to find sth pleasant, attractive or satisfactory; to enjoy sth
Do you like their new house?
data.chText: 你喜欢他们的新房子吗？

data.enText: I like to see them enjoying themselves.
data.chText: 我就愿意看着他们玩得高兴。

data.enText: love
to like or enjoy sth very much
He loved the way she smiled.
be fond of sth
to like or enjoy sth, especially sth you have liked or enjoyed for a long time
data.chText: 指喜爱（尤指已爱上很长时间的事物）：

data.enText: We were fond of the house and didn't want to leave.
data.chText: 我们喜欢上了这座房子，不想搬家。

data.enText: be keen on sth
( BrE informal ) (often used in negative statements) to like or enjoy sth
I'm not keen on spicy food.
data.chText: 我不喜欢加有香料的食物。

data.enText: She's not keen on being told what to do.
data.chText: 她不喜欢别人向她发号施令。

data.enText: adore
( informal ) to like or enjoy sth very much
She adores working with children.
love or adore?
Adore is more informal than love , and is used to express a stronger feeling.
data.chText: adore较love非正式，用以表达更强烈的感情。

data.enText: to like/love/be fond of/be keen on/adore doing sth
to like/love to do sth
to like/love sth very much
I like/love/adore it here/there/when…
to like/love/adore the way sb does sth
to really like/love/adore sb/sth
to be really fond of/keen on sth
to quite/rather like sth

data.text: love ♦ like ♦ be fond of ♦ adore ♦ be devoted to ♦ care for ♦ dote on/upon

data.enText: These words all mean to have feelings of love or affection for sb.
data.chText: 以上各词均含喜爱、爱慕（某人）之义。

data.enText: love
to have strong feelings of affection for sb
I love you.
like
to find sb pleasant and enjoy being with them
She's nice. I like her.
be fond of sb
to feel affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time
data.chText: 指喜爱（尤指认识已久的人）：

data.enText: I've always been very fond of your mother.
data.chText: 我一直非常喜欢你的母亲。

data.enText: adore
to love sb very much
It's obvious that she adores him.
be devoted to sb
to love sb very much and be loyal to them
They are devoted to their children.
data.chText: 他们深爱着自己的孩子。

data.enText: care for sb
to love sb, especially in a way that is based on strong affection or a feeling of wanting to protect them, rather than sex
data.chText: 指深深地爱、非常喜欢，但不指性爱：

data.enText: He cared for her more than she realized.
data.chText: 她不知道他是多么在乎她。

data.enText: Care for is often used when sb has not told anyone about their feelings or is just starting to be aware of them. It is also used when sb wishes that sb loved them, or doubts that sb does.
data.chText: care for常用于未向任何人吐露感情或刚开始意识到这种感情时，亦用于希望别人爱自己或怀疑别人是否爱自己时：

data.enText: If he really cared for you, he wouldn't behave like that.
data.chText: 如果他真的在乎你，就不会那样表现。

data.enText: dote on sb
to feel and show great love for sb, ignoring their faults
He dotes on his children.
to really love/like/adore/care for/dote on sb
to be really/genuinely fond of/devoted to sb
to love/like/care for sb very much
to love/adore sb passionately
(just) for love
(just) for the love of sth
without receiving payment or any other reward
data.chText: 出于爱好；不收报酬；无偿

data.enText: They're all volunteers, working for the love of it.
data.chText: 他们都是义务工作的志愿者。

data.enText: for the love of God
used when you are expressing anger and the fact that you are impatient
data.chText: （表示愤怒和不耐烦）看在上帝的分上，哎呀，求求你

data.enText: For the love of God, tell me what he said!
data.chText: 看在上帝的分上，告诉我他说了些什么！

data.enText: give/send my love to sb
used to send good wishes to sb
Give my love to Mary when you see her.
data.chText: 见到玛丽代我向她问好。

data.enText: Bob sends his love.
love from
lots of love (from)
used at the end of a letter to a friend or to sb you love, followed by your name
data.chText: （用于给朋友或所爱的人的信结尾具名前）爱你的

data.enText: Lots of love, Jenny
love is blind
when you love sb, you cannot see their faults
data.chText: 爱情是盲目的，爱让人蒙蔽双眼（指恋爱中的人看不到对方缺点）

data.enText: make love (to sb)
to have sex
It was the first time they had made love.
data.chText: 那是他们第一次发生性关系。

data.enText: not for love or/nor money
if you say you cannot do sth for love nor money , you mean it is completely impossible to do it
there's little/no love lost between A and B
they do not like each other
There's no love lost between her and her in-laws.
data.chText: 她和她的姻亲彼此嫌恶。

data.enText: cupboard love
affection that sb, especially a child, shows towards sb else in order to get sth
data.chText: （尤指小孩为获得某物的）有所企图的亲热

data.enText: all's fair in love and war
in some situations any type of behaviour is acceptable to get what you want
data.chText: 在情场和战场上可以不择手段

data.enText: head over heels in love
loving sb very much
He's fallen head over heels in love with his boss.
data.chText: 他深深迷恋上了他的上司。

data.enText: a labour of love
a hard task that you do because you want to, not because it is necessary
data.chText: 为爱好而做的困难工作

data.enText: love you and leave you
used to say that you must go, although you would like to stay longer
data.chText: （表示想留而必须离开）不得不走

data.enText: Well, time to love you and leave you.
data.chText: 唉，我该走了，不想走也得走哇。

synonyms.bx: 指热爱国家、组织等，词义庄重，感情色彩浓厚；也指爱慕某人或深爱亲友等。

ex.chText: 每个人都爱自己的家乡。

ex.enText: I love my dad very much.

synonyms.bx: 指非常热爱或敬佩某人，并以其为骄傲。

ex.chText: 男孩们敬慕他们的母亲。

synonyms.bx: 尤指非常爱慕某人乃至看不到其缺点。

ex.enText: She worshipped him and refused to listen to his critics.
ex.chText: 她很仰慕他,听不进别人对他的批评。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指对某人、某事物或做某事产生好感或兴趣，语义较弱；也指赞同某事。

ex.enText: I like the way you've had your hair done.
I don't like swearing in front of children.
ex.chText: 我不喜欢在孩子面前说粗话。

synonyms.bx: 指享受某事物带来的乐趣，其后常接动名词而不接动词不定式。

ex.enText: I don't enjoy travelling a lot.
How did you enjoy the concert?

synonyms.bx: 指喜爱（做）某事，语义较强，常可与 like 换用。

ex.enText: I love/like taking a long walk in the morning.
ex.chText: 我喜欢早晨长距离散步。

ex.enText: He loves/likes to talk about himself.
